DOC.brief_title: Diagnostic Reasoning and Sense of Alarm at Dyspnoea and / or Chest Pain
DOC.detailed_description: Dyspnea and chest pain represent 1.5% of general practice consultations. They may be a sign of many diseases, potentially serious. The concept of Gut Feelings brings a sense of alarm and reinsurance. The sense of alarm reflects a sense of mistrust about the patient's clinical situation, in the absence of objective argument. The sense of reinsurance reflects a sense of confidence about the patient's situation, in the absence of objective argument. Gut Feelings plays a key role in the diagnostic reasoning in general practice. A questionnaire measuring the Gut Feelings was validated in French after a linguistic validation procedure. The objective of the research is to calculate the precision of the sense of alarm the general practitioner facing a consultant for chest pain or dyspnea and patient
